Question 32) Climate/society interface can be considered in terms of adjustment to extension and ways in which societies work in a harmonic relationship with its climate. Man and his societies are vulnerable to climate variations. Vulnerability is the measure that a society is likely to suffer from climate causes.
AYOADE, J. O. Introduction to climatology for the tropics. Considering the type of relationship between human being and climate condition presented in the text, a society becomes more vulnerable when
A) concentrates its activities in the primary sector.
B) has high food stocks.
C) has an articulated transport system.
D) diversifies the power generation matrix.
E) introduces technologies to agricultural production.
